page.title: 08PEOPLE OF LITTLE BARFORD.
page.content: On Monday June 17th,at 10.05 Miss Dickinson took,Sean,Dean,Darren,Tracy and June to{Little Barford}in her car.The car was parked near an old school and we started to walk along the path next to the main road (B1043).We met an elderly lady her name was Mrs Morris,we said can we ask you a few questions.She did'nt mind.First we asked her when the school had been closed down, she said before the war.It had then reopened during the war when the{evacuees}came from Walthamstowe.There was only one teacher who taught all ages.Then we asked who gave permissian to go on the bumpy road to the railway and then go up to the hill.The hill used to have a cottage and the Bailiff used to live there, but now it has been pulled down.She said the farm manager lives at number four.
